metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45412 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When resolving a symlink such as file:///proc/self/fd/1, an error message may be produced where the symlink was resolved to a string containing unitialized memory in the buffer.
*This bug only affects Thunderbird on Unix-based operated systems (Android, Linux, MacOS). Windows is unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1 No subscription required
